tips.title: Âø´ÈÄüÊñá‰ª∂ÂØºËà™
tips.content: Êåâ `Ctrl+P` Âø´ÈÄüÊêúÁ¥¢Âπ∂ÊâìÂºÄÂ∑•‰ΩúÂå∫‰∏≠ÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂„ÄÇÂºÄÂßãÈîÆÂÖ•Êñá‰ª∂Âêç‰ª•ËøáÊª§ÂàóË°®„ÄÇ

tips.title: ÂëΩ‰ª§Èù¢Êùø
tips.content: ‰ΩøÁî® `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Windows/Linux) Êàñ `Cmd+Shift+P` (macOS) ËÆøÈóÆÊâÄÊúâ VS Code ÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇËøôÊòØ‰Ω†‰ΩøÁî® VS Code ÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂäüËÉΩÁöÑÂÖ•Âè£ÔºÅ

tips.content: Êåâ‰Ωè `Alt`ÔºàmacOS ‰∏∫ `Option`ÔºâÂπ∂ÁÇπÂáª‰ª•Ê∑ªÂä†Â§ö‰∏™ÂÖâÊ†áÔºåÂêåÊó∂ÁºñËæëÂ§öË°å„ÄÇ

tips.title: Âπ∂ÊéíÁºñËæë

tips.content: Êåâ `Ctrl+Shift+O` Âú®ÂΩìÂâçÊñá‰ª∂ÊåâÁ¨¶Âè∑Ë∑≥ËΩ¨„ÄÇ

tips.title: Â∑•‰ΩúÂå∫Á¨¶Âè∑ÊêúÁ¥¢
tips.content: Êåâ `Ctrl+T` Âú®Êï¥‰∏™Â∑•‰ΩúÂå∫ÊêúÁ¥¢Á¨¶Âè∑„ÄÇ

tips.content: ÈÄöËøá Êñá‰ª∂ > Ëá™Âä®‰øùÂ≠ò ÊàñËÆæÁΩÆ `files.autoSave` ‰∏∫ 'afterDelay' ÂºÄÂêØËá™Âä®‰øùÂ≠ò„ÄÇ

tips.title: Â¢ûÂä†/ÂáèÂ∞ëÁº©Ëøõ
tips.content: Áî® `Ctrl+]` Â¢ûÂä†Áº©ËøõÔºå`Ctrl+[` ÂáèÂ∞ëÁº©Ëøõ„ÄÇ

tips.content: ‰ΩøÁî®ÁªàÁ´ØÊ†áÈ¢òÊ†è + ÊåâÈíÆÊàñÂëΩ‰ª§ 'Split Terminal' ÂàÜÂâ≤ÁªàÁ´Ø„ÄÇ

tips.content: Êåâ `Ctrl+K Ctrl+X` Âà†Èô§Ë°åÂ∞æÂ§ö‰ΩôÁ©∫ÁôΩ„ÄÇ

tips.title: Open File
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+O` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+O` (macOS) to open a file dialog. Quickly browse and open files from anywhere on your system.

tips.title: Save File
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+S` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+S` (macOS) to save the current file. One of the most essential shortcuts!

tips.title: Save As
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+S` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+S` (macOS) to save the current file with a new name or location.

tips.title: Close Editor
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+F4` or `Ctrl+W` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+W` (macOS) to close the current editor tab.

tips.title: Close All Editors
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K Ctrl+W` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+W` (macOS) to close all open editor tabs at once.

tips.title: Reopen Closed Editor
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+T` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+T` (macOS) to reopen the last closed editor tab. Perfect for when you accidentally close something!

tips.title: Toggle Full Screen
tips.content: Press `F11` to toggle full screen mode. Maximize your screen real estate for distraction-free coding!

tips.title: Toggle Editor Layout
tips.content: Use `Shift+Alt+0` (Windows/Linux) or `Shift+Option+0` (macOS) to toggle between horizontal and vertical editor layout.

tips.title: Zoom In/Out
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+=` to zoom in and `Ctrl+-` to zoom out (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+=` / `Cmd+-` (macOS). Adjust the editor's font size quickly!

tips.title: Show Explorer
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+E` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+E` (macOS) to show the Explorer view and toggle focus. Quick access to your file tree!

tips.title: Show Source Control
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+G` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+G` (macOS) to open the Source Control view. Manage your Git operations efficiently!

tips.title: Show Debug
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+D` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+D` (macOS) to open the Debug view. Start debugging your code quickly!

tips.title: Show Extensions
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+X` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+X` (macOS) to open the Extensions view. Discover and manage your VS Code extensions!

tips.title: Replace in Files
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+H` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+H` (macOS) to open replace in files. Search and replace across your entire project!

tips.title: Toggle Search Details
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+J` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+J` (macOS) to toggle search details. Show or hide additional search options!

tips.title: Show Output Panel
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+U` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+U` (macOS) to show the Output panel. View logs and output from extensions and tools!

tips.title: Open Markdown Preview
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+V` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+V` (macOS) to open Markdown preview. See your markdown rendered in real-time!

tips.title: Markdown Preview Side by Side
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K V` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K V` (macOS) to open Markdown preview to the side. Edit and preview simultaneously!

tips.title: Toggle Breakpoint
tips.content: Press `F9` to toggle a breakpoint at the current line. Essential for debugging your code!

tips.title: Start/Continue Debugging
tips.content: Use `F5` to start debugging or continue execution when paused. Quick way to run your debug sessions!

tips.title: Stop Debugging
tips.content: Press `Shift+F5` to stop the current debugging session. End your debug session quickly!

tips.title: Step Into/Out
tips.content: Use `F11` to step into a function and `Shift+F11` to step out. Navigate through your code during debugging!

tips.title: Step Over
tips.content: Press `F10` to step over the current line during debugging. Execute the current line and move to the next!

tips.title: Show Hover
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+I` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+I` (macOS) to show hover information. See documentation and type information on demand!

tips.title: Create New Terminal
tips.content: Press `` Ctrl+Shift+` `` (Windows/Linux) or `` Cmd+Shift+` `` (macOS) to create a new terminal instance. Run multiple terminal sessions!

tips.title: Find in File
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+F` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+F` (macOS) to open find in the current file. Search within your active editor!

tips.title: Replace in File
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+H` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+H` (macOS) to open find and replace in the current file. Quickly modify text patterns!

tips.title: Find Next/Previous
tips.content: Use `F3` to find next and `Shift+F3` to find previous occurrence. Navigate through search results efficiently!

tips.title: Select All Occurrences
tips.content: Press `Alt+Enter` (Windows/Linux) or `Option+Enter` (macOS) to select all occurrences of the current find match. Edit multiple instances at once!

tips.title: Move Selection to Next Match
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+D` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+D` (macOS) to move the last selection to the next find match. Skip unwanted matches!

tips.title: Toggle Find Options
tips.content: Press `Alt+C` for case-sensitive, `Alt+R` for regex, and `Alt+W` for whole word matching in find. Customize your search!

tips.title: Insert Cursor Above/Below
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Alt+Up` or `Ctrl+Alt+Down` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Option+Up` / `Cmd+Option+Down` (macOS) to insert cursors above or below. Create multiple cursors vertically!

tips.title: Undo Cursor Operation
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+U` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+U` (macOS) to undo the last cursor operation. Revert unwanted cursor additions!

tips.title: Insert Cursor at Line Ends
tips.content: Use `Shift+Alt+I` (Windows/Linux) or `Shift+Option+I` (macOS) to insert a cursor at the end of each selected line. Edit multiple line endings!

tips.title: Select Current Line
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+L` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+L` (macOS) to select the current line. Quick selection without using the mouse!

tips.title: Select All Occurrences of Selection
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+L` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+L` (macOS) to select all occurrences of the current selection. Powerful multi-cursor editing!

tips.title: Select All Occurrences of Word
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+F2` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+F2` (macOS) to select all occurrences of the current word. Quick word-based multi-editing!

tips.title: Expand/Shrink Selection
tips.content: Use `Shift+Alt+Right` to expand and `Shift+Alt+Left` to shrink selection (Windows/Linux) or `Shift+Option+Right` / `Shift+Option+Left` (macOS). Smart selection based on syntax!

tips.title: Column Selection
tips.content: Hold `Shift+Alt` and drag with the mouse (Windows/Linux) or `Shift+Option` (macOS) for column (box) selection. Select rectangular regions of text!

tips.title: Column Selection with Keyboard
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+Alt` with arrow keys (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+Option` with arrow keys (macOS) for column selection. Box select without a mouse!

tips.title: Trigger Parameter Hints
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+Space` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+Space` (macOS) to trigger parameter hints. See function parameters while coding!

tips.title: Format Selection
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+F` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+F` (macOS) to format the selected code. Keep your selected code neat and consistent!

tips.title: Peek Definition
tips.content: Press `Alt+F12` (Windows/Linux) or `Option+F12` (macOS) to peek at the definition inline. View definitions without losing context!

tips.title: Open Definition to Side
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K F12` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K F12` (macOS) to open the definition in a side editor. Compare definitions and implementations!

tips.title: Change File Language
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K M` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K M` (macOS) to change the file language mode. Switch syntax highlighting and features!

tips.title: Close Folder
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K F` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K F` (macOS) to close the current folder/workspace. Switch workspaces quickly!

tips.title: Focus Editor Groups
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+1`, `Ctrl+2`, or `Ctrl+3` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+1`, `Cmd+2`, `Cmd+3` (macOS) to focus into the 1st, 2nd, or 3rd editor group!

tips.title: Focus Next/Previous Editor Group
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+Right` or `Ctrl+K Ctrl+Left` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+Right` / `Cmd+K Cmd+Left` (macOS) to focus into the next or previous editor group!

tips.title: Move Editor Left/Right
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+PgUp` or `Ctrl+Shift+PgDn` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+PgUp` / `Cmd+Shift+PgDn` (macOS) to move the editor left or right!

tips.title: Move Active Editor Group
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Left` or `Ctrl+K Right` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Left` / `Cmd+K Right` (macOS) to move the active editor group!

tips.title: New Window
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+N` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+N` (macOS) to open a new VS Code window/instance. Work with multiple projects simultaneously!

tips.title: Close Window
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+W` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+W` (macOS) to close the current VS Code window/instance!

tips.title: User Settings
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+,` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+,` (macOS) to open User Settings. Customize your VS Code experience!

tips.title: Keyboard Shortcuts Settings
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+S` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+S` (macOS) to open Keyboard Shortcuts settings. Customize or view all shortcuts!

tips.title: Cut Line
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+X` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+X` (macOS) with no selection to cut the entire line. Quick line cutting!

tips.title: Copy Line
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+C` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+C` (macOS) with no selection to copy the entire line. Quick line copying!

tips.title: Delete Line
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+K` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+K` (macOS) to delete the current line. Faster than selecting and deleting!

tips.title: Insert Line Below
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Enter` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Enter` (macOS) to insert a new line below the current line. No need to move to the end first!

tips.title: Insert Line Above
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+Enter` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+Enter` (macOS) to insert a new line above the current line!

tips.title: Jump to Matching Bracket
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+\` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+\` (macOS) to jump to the matching bracket. Navigate code structures quickly!

tips.title: Go to Line Start/End
tips.content: Press `Home` to go to the beginning of the line and `End` to go to the end. Quick line navigation!

tips.title: Go to File Start/End
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Home` to go to the beginning of the file and `Ctrl+End` to go to the end (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Home` / `Cmd+End` (macOS)!

tips.title: Scroll Line Up/Down
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Up` or `Ctrl+Down` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Up` / `Cmd+Down` (macOS) to scroll the view up or down one line without moving the cursor!

tips.title: Scroll Page Up/Down
tips.content: Use `Alt+PgUp` or `Alt+PgDn` (Windows/Linux) or `Option+PgUp` / `Option+PgDn` (macOS) to scroll the view up or down by one page!

tips.title: Fold All Subregions
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K Ctrl+[` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+[` (macOS) to fold (collapse) all subregions in the current region!

tips.title: Unfold All Subregions
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+]` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+]` (macOS) to unfold (uncollapse) all subregions in the current region!

tips.title: Fold All Regions
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K Ctrl+0` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+0` (macOS) to fold (collapse) all regions in the file. Minimize all code blocks!

tips.title: Unfold All Regions
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+J` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+J` (macOS) to unfold (uncollapse) all regions in the file. Expand all code blocks!

tips.title: Add Line Comment
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K Ctrl+C` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+C` (macOS) to add line comments. Comment out multiple lines!

tips.title: Remove Line Comment
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+U` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Cmd+U` (macOS) to remove line comments. Uncomment multiple lines!

tips.title: Toggle Block Comment
tips.content: Press `Shift+Alt+A` (Windows/Linux) or `Shift+Option+A` (macOS) to toggle block comments. Use /* */ style comments!

tips.title: Go to Line
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+G` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+G` (macOS) to open the Go to Line dialog. Jump to any line number quickly!

tips.title: Go to Next Error
tips.content: Press `F8` to navigate to the next error or warning in your code. Fix issues efficiently!

tips.title: Go to Previous Error
tips.content: Use `Shift+F8` to navigate to the previous error or warning in your code. Review all issues!

tips.title: Toggle Tab Moves Focus
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+M` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+M` (macOS) to toggle whether Tab moves focus or inserts a tab character. Accessibility feature!

tips.title: Keep Preview Mode Open
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Enter` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K Enter` (macOS) to keep the preview mode editor open permanently. Prevent accidental tab closure!

tips.title: Copy Active File Path
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K P` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K P` (macOS) to copy the path of the active file to the clipboard. Share file locations easily!

tips.title: Reveal File in Explorer
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K R` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K R` (macOS) to reveal the active file in the system file explorer. Locate files on your system!

tips.title: Show File in New Window
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K O` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+K O` (macOS) to show the active file in a new window/instance. Work with the same file in multiple windows!
